sourceString: In the wake of Cornell's decision to keep students home following spring break and transition to virtual instruction, the Mayor of Ithaca called for "immediate and forceful federal action — we will see a horrific economic impact as a result of Cornell University closing."
targetString: Ha hasduye Cornell ngam siggugo jaangoɓe ha saare ha ɓawo siwtare spring be sallinol ha ekkitolji be do internati, Marɗo lesdi Ithaca ewni ngam "dabare jaawal be dole lesdi, e mattan saɗirmaji ɗuɗɗum ngam maɓɓol Cornell University."

sourceString: UNESCO is sharing 10 recommendations during this period:
targetString: UNESCO ɗon senda feeloji 10 ha wakati nnde:

sourceString: Examine the readiness and choose the most relevant tools: Decide on the use high-technology and low-technology solutions based on the reliability of local power supplies, internet connectivity, and digital skills of teachers and students.
targetString: Lartu ko je ɗon taski timmi e suɓɓu je ɓuri naffugo: Hasdu ngam dabareji je ɓuri mala je lessi naffugo do amana do yite, jokkitol internati, be aandalji jaanginoɓe be jaangoɓe ngam internati.

sourceString: This could range through integrated digital learning platforms, video lessons, MOOCs, to broadcasting through radios and TVs.
targetString: Ndu footi salla gal baabe ekkitolji, jaangirde be vidiyo, MOOC, ngewte gal radiyo be tele.

sourceString: Ensure inclusion of the distance learning programmes: Implement measures to ensure that students including those with disabilities or from low-income backgrounds have access to distance learning programmes, if only a limited number of them have access to digital devices.
targetString: Nastinol dabare jaahargalji ekkitol dayindi: Waɗugo dabareji ngam heɓɓa jaangoɓe be ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau diga danyinki mala je wurti caalaje je ɗon tampi mari dabare nastirde ha jaahargalji ekkitol dayindi, to footi ɓe'en feere footi mara dabare heɓɓugo nastirde ha ordoji internati.

sourceString: Consider temporarily decentralising such devices from computer labs to families and support them with internet connectivity.
targetString: Lartugo sankitolji ordoji bana computer labs ha caalaje e walla ɓe jokkitol internati ha nder wakati seeɗa.

sourceString: Protect data privacy and data security: Assess data security when uploading data or educational resources to web spaces, as well as when sharing them with other organisations or individuals.
targetString: Fadugo amana matinolji be jam matinolji: Lartugo jam matinolji ha yakke nastinol matinolji mala dabareji ekkitol ha do hawo, be sendugo ndu be geeɓeji feere mala be yimɓe feere.

sourceString: Ensure that the use of applications and platforms does not violate students' data privacy.
targetString: Waɗugo yo'o huwidol be applikasionji be daldalji memmata amana matinolji jaangowo.

sourceString: Prioritize solutions to address psychosocial challenges before teaching: Mobilize available tools to connect schools, parents, teachers, and students with each other.
targetString: Hokkugo mangu ha dabareji nattinugo larulaji hakkilo: moftugo kujeji je ɗon wondi ngam jokkugo jaangirdeji, baabiraɓe, jaanginoɓe, be jaangoɓe oya be oya.

sourceString: Create communities to ensure regular human interactions, enable social caring measures, and address possible psychosocial challenges that students may face when they are isolated.
targetString: Wurtinugo ummatoji ngam wanginugo dabareji feere-feere ha kunde yimɓe, waɗugo dabareji suklugo do ummatore, e willugo saɗirmaji feere je footi memma hakkilo jaangoɓe to ɓe ɗon joɗɗi feere maɓɓe.

sourceString: Plan the study schedule of the distance learning programmes: Organise discussions with stakeholders to examine the possible duration of school closures and decide whether the distance learning programme should focus on teaching new knowledge or enhance students' knowledge of prior lessons.
targetString: Waɗugo jaahargalji ngam dabareji ekkitol nayinde: ngewta be mawɓe ngam lartugo neeɓol maɓɓolji jaangirde je footi waɗa be hasdugo to jaahargal ekkitol dayinde wondan do jaanginugo kujeji keese mala lartugo ko ɓe jaangi timmi ha nder suudu jaangirde.

sourceString: Plan the schedule depending on the situation of the affected zones, level of studies, needs of students needs, and availability of parents.
targetString: Waɗugo jaahargal do jonde wakkere nde, ta'irde jaangirdeji, haajeji jaangoɓe, be wondugo baabiraɓe.

sourceString: Choose the appropriate learning methodologies based on the status of school closures and home-based quarantines.
targetString: Suɓɓugo dabareji jaangirdeji kanduɗum do maɓɓolji jaangirde e do wondugo ha seera ha saare bo'o.

sourceString: Avoid learning methodologies that require face-to-face communication.
targetString: Luttugo dabareji ekkitol je ɗon emma ngewte je gite nder gite.

sourceString: Provide support to teachers and parents on the use of digital tools: Organise brief training or orientation sessions for teachers and parents as well, if monitoring and facilitation are needed.
targetString: Hokkugo wallende ha jaanginoɓe ba baabiraɓe do kujeji kugal be internati: taskugo geeɓeji ekkitol mala feelore ngam jaanginoɓe be baabiraɓe fu, to aynol be wallende naffan.

sourceString: Help teachers to prepare the basic settings such as solutions to the use of internet data if they are required to provide live streaming of lessons.
targetString: Wallugo jaangoɓe taskugo wakkere aranool bana dabareji huwugo be internati to ɓe emmotto waɗugo jaangirde gal wondugo ha yeeso jaangoɓe nder ordo.

sourceString: Blend appropriate approaches and limit the number of applications and platforms: Blend tools or media that are available for most students, both for synchronous communication and lessons, and for asynchronous learning.
targetString: Hawtugo dabareji kanduɗum e darna limgal applikasionji e daaldal: Hawtugo kujeji mala dabareji je ɗon ngondi ha ɓurna jaangoɓe fu, ɗiɗi fu ngam ha ngewte be ekkitolji yahida boɗɗum, be jaangirde je ɗon feere.

sourceString: Avoid overloading students and parents by asking them to download and test too many applications or platforms.
targetString: Accugo hebbinugo applikasionji mala daaldal ha jaangoɓe be baabiraɓe gal emmugo ɓe hoosugo e waɗɗugo kujeji jur.

sourceString: Develop distance learning rules and monitor students' learning process: Define the rules with parents and students on distance learning.
targetString: Wurtinugo tawretaji jaangirde dayindi be fadugo laahal jaangirde jaangowo: sappinugo tawretaji do jaangirde dayinki ha baabiraɓe be jaangoɓe.

sourceString: Design formative questions, tests, or exercises to monitor closely students' learning process.
targetString: Dida emmolji, lartolji, kuɗe ekkitol ngam fadugo laahal ekkitol jaangoɓe.

sourceString: Try to use tools to support submission of students' feedback and avoid overloading parents by requesting them to scan and send students' feedback
targetString: Foondugo huwugo be kujeji ngam wallugo jaangowo ngewta be moɗon e accugo emmugo baabiraɓe gal emmugo ɓe ngam hoosa foto e nelda ngewte jaangoɓe be hoore maɓɓe.

sourceString: Define the duration of distance learning units based on students' self-regulation skills: Keep a coherent timing according to the level of the students' self-regulation and metacognitive abilities especially for livestreaming classes.
targetString: Hokkugo wakati ekkitol dayindi do dabare wondugo aandalji jaangoɓe: Wurtinugo jaahargal je ɗon yahida be yaɓɓorde jaangirde be dabareji aandal feere-feere ɓurna fu je jaangirdeji je gite be gite do ordo.

sourceString: Preferably, the unit for primary school students should not be more than 20 minutes, and no longer than 40 minutes for secondary school students.
targetString: Ndikka yo'o, ekkitol jaangoɓe jaangirde aranool ta ɓura minti 20, e ta ɓura minti 40 je jaangoɓe jaangirde ɗiɗaɓool.

sourceString: Create communities and enhance connection: Create communities of teachers, parents, and school managers to address sense of loneliness or helplessness, facilitate sharing of experience and discussion on coping strategies when facing learning difficulties.
targetString: Wurtinugo ummatoreji e haɓda ngam ngidol: wanginugo ummatoreji jaanginoɓe, baabiraɓe, be arduɓe jaangirde ngam tato ɓe wona feere maɓɓe mala bila wallende,  latina saanjol aandal be ngewte kooyɗum do dabareji wurtol to wodi saɗirmaji nder ekkitol.

targetString: Jaangoɓe milionji 290 ha yaasi jaangirde ngam COVID-19: UNESCO wurtini aranool limgal duniyaru e hawti jabbuye, UNESCO.

sourceString: and WHEREAS for the preservation of public health and safety throughout the entire State of California, I find it necessary for all Californians to heed the State public health directives from the Department of Public Health.

sourceString: 1) To preserve the public health and safety, and to ensure the healthcare delivery system is capable of serving all, and prioritizing those at the highest risk and vulnerability, all residents are directed to immediately heed the current State public health directives, which I ordered the Department of Public Health to develop for the current statewide status of COVID-19.

sourceString: ORDER OF THE STATE PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICER
targetString: TAWRETA ARDUƊO JAM ƁAANDU LESDI

sourceString: To protect public health, I as State Public Health Officer and Director of the California Department of Public Health order all individuals living in the State of California to stay home or at their place of residence except as needed to maintain continuity of operations of the federal critical infrastructure sectors, as outlined at https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.
targetString: Ngam fadugo jam ɓaandu ummatore, Min Arduɗo Jam Ɓaandu Lesdi be Ɗowuwo Geeɓe Jam Ɓaandu hasdi ko moy fu je nyeeɗatta ha do Lesdi California joɗɗa ha saare mala ha wakkere jonde mako sna to ngam tokkitugo kugal lesdi je larni kujeji yahde lesdi, bana ɗon limti ha https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

sourceString: In addition, and in consultation with the Director of the Governor's Office of Emergency Services, I may designate additional sectors as critical in order to protect the health and well-being of all Californians.
targetString: Ha ɓesdugo, e be ngewte be Ɗowuwo Suudu Ngomna je Suklata do Kuɗe Jaawal, footi mi suɓɓa wakkereji feere to wodi haaje ngam fadugo jam ɓaandu e jam woore jeeyaɓe California.

sourceString: Pursuant to the authority under the Health and Safety Code 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 and 120150, this order is to go into effect immediately and shall stay in effect until further notice.
targetString: Bana ɗon limti ha nder Umrore Jam Ɓaandu e Jam 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 be 120150, tawreta ndu hoccan sembe diga jonta e tokkitan ha to batakkewol feere wurti.

sourceString: The federal government has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors whose assets, systems, and networks, whether physical or virtual, are considered so vital to the United States that their incapacitation or destruction would have a debilitating effect on security, economic security, public health or safety, or any combination thereof.
targetString: Ngomna lesdi maandi wakkereji je ɗon mari saɗirmaji 16 je kuɗe, dabareji, be kawtirdeji maɓɓe, ko je ɗon lara be je ko laratta, lati bana kanduɗum ha Lesɗe America je sembe maɓɓe timmi mala woni ɗon mari sababu do jam, jam siggorde, jam ɓaandu mala jam, mala hawtirde feere.

sourceString: I order that Californians working in these 16 critical infrastructure sectors may continue their work because of the importance of these sectors to Californians' health and well-being.
targetString: Mi ɗon hasda yo'o ummatore California je ɗon huwa ha wakereji sababu 16 ndu footi tokkita kuɗe maɓɓe ngam naffuda wakkereji ndu ha jam ɓaandu e jam yimɓe California.

sourceString: This Order is being issued to protect the public health of Californians.
targetString: Tawreta ndu wurtutto ngam fadugo jam ɓaandu yimɓe California.

sourceString: The California Department of Public Health looks to establish consistency across the state in order to ensure that we mitigate the impact of COVID-19.
targetString: Geeɓe Jam Ɓaandu Ummatore yiɗi teffugo tokkitol ha nder lesdi ngam heɓɓa en usta sembe COVID-19.

sourceString: Our goal is simple, we want to bend the curve, and disrupt the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kugal amin ɗon kooyɗum, min yiɗi ustugo yahde, e darnugo sankittol viriis.

sourceString: The supply chain must continue, and Californians must have access to such necessities as food, prescriptions, and health care.
targetString: Addugo kujeji sey tokkita, e ummatore California sey mara dabare heɓɓugo irin kujeji ndu bana nyamdu ndu, lekki, jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: When people need to leave their homes or places of residence, whether to obtain or perform the functions above, or to otherwise facilitate authorized necessary activities, they should at all times practice social distancing.
targetString: To yimɓe yiɗi wurtugo saare maɓɓe mala wakkere jonde maɓɓe, temma ngam heɓɓugo mala waɗugo ko ɗon limti ha do ndu, mala latinugo kuɗe je ɗon jarfi kooyɗum, sey ko moy fu daya oya be oya.

sourceString: 2) The healthcare delivery system shall prioritize services to serving those who are the sickest and shall prioritize resources, including personal protective equipment, for the providers providing direct care to them.
targetString: 2) Dabare suklare do jam ɓandu hokkan arandere sa'a ha kuɗe je suklatta do yimɓe je ɓuri nyaugo e hokkan bo'o sa'a ha dabareji, bana kujeji fadol, ha huwoɓe je suklatta do maɓɓe.

sourceString: 3) The Office of Emergency Services is directed to take necessary steps to ensure compliance with this Order.
targetString: 3) Ɗowirɗ e Kuɗe Jaawal feelama ngam hoosugo yaɓɓordeji ngam ɗowtinugo ha Tawreta ndu.

sourceString: 4) This Order shall be enforceable pursuant to California law, including, but not limited to, Government Code section 8665.

sourceString: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that as soon as hereafter possible, this Order be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and that widespread publicity and notice be given of this Order.

sourceString: The disease is a type of coronavirus, the same family that includes SARS, MERS, and some varieties of the common cold.

targetString: Ndu na ngam fadugo mon tan, amma yimɓe je a ngidi be maɓɓe.

sourceString: As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
targetString: Bana ɗon salla, walla ko on majjinata jur ngam wondugo ha saare, ngam baabe ngilli ɗuɗɗum ha nder duniyaru ɗon maɓɓa dammuɗe maɓɓe ngam darnugo sankittol nyau ndu.

sourceString: If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.
targetString: To a mari haaje waɗugo jaahangal, hakkilu bana a wawi ngam nyauji feere: lallu juɗe ma be wakati fu, ta memmu yeeso maɗa, sondu e ɓislu do cakkare jokke jungo maɗa mala nder leepol, e luttu yimɓe je ɗon nyauɗo.

sourceString: Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
targetString: Hiddeko a waɗa jaahangal, jaangu ko ɗon matini do man dabareji do jaahangal ɗon saanja umtum ha nder duniyaru.

sourceString: After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
targetString: Ha ɓawo jaahangal lartu jam ɓaandu maɗa e lartu wondugo ha seera be hoore maɗa ngam ta a sallina nyau ha yimɓe feere.

sourceString: Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.
targetString: Hortol be pireewolji hoorugo yimɓe diga lesdi dayindi ha mootaji wakkereji ustotto mala darnotto fu ha nder lesɗe jur ngam emmolji be tawretaji ngomna'en.

sourceString: Many international and regional borders are closed.
targetString: Keerolji lesɗe be wakkereji ɗuɗɗum maɓɓotto.

sourceString: If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
targetString: To a wonday no saare, e to a ɗon woni ha nder lesdi feere, haɓdu wartugo law; ndu footi lati caɗɗungel ngam darnolji ɗon tokkita.

sourceString: In some cases it may simply not be possible, even if you're healthy and meet the legal requirements for entry.
targetString: Ha yakke feere ma footay waɗa sam, ko to a ɗon woni jam e mari jarfuji nastugo nder lesdi man.

sourceString: If you can't find a way back to your country, contact your nearest embassy or consulate for assistance.
targetString: To footay a warta ha nder lesdi maɗa, jokkitu fadawo mala ngomna lesdi moɗon je ɗon ɓadi ngam wallende.

sourceString: They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
targetString: Footi ɓe taska hortol, teffa pireewool je nastay no nder jaahargal, mala hokka ma ceede jaawal ngam ha a yoɓɓa hortol maɗa.

sourceString: In case they can't, make preparations in case you need to stay where you are for an extended period.
targetString: To ɓe footay ngaɗa ndu, tasku to bana a yiɗi joɗɗugo ha wakkere je a ɗon wondi ha ton nder wakati seeɗa.

sourceString: If you do find a way back home, be prepared that it may be expensive, inconvenient, and have unusual restrictions (such as no checked baggage).
targetString: To a taway dabare wartugo saare, taskittu ngam footi nawa, bila feecugo, e marugo haɗɗolji je on woway be man (bana kujeji ma lartay).

sourceString: As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
targetString: Ha fuɗɗam Aviiril 2020, limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 ɓadi ni milionre.

sourceString: Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
targetString: Ko to nyau man fuɗɗi ha lesdi Cayna, sankitti ha nder duniyaru fu e Cayna ɗon mari nyauɓe je ɗon aandi mari be mayɓe seeɗa tan do lesɗe feere.

sourceString: Europe is the new epicenter of the pandemic.
targetString: Erop lati ɓundu keese nyau duniyaru ndu.

sourceString: All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.
targetString: Lesɗe fu sna ndego-ndego tan matini pettum man nyauɗo gooto, be limtol nyauɓe ha Lesɗe America, Spain, Italy, Jaamani, Faraansa, lesdi Cayna, Iran, be Lesɗe Inglisiya.

sourceString: Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
targetString: Sallinol ha wakkere wonotto ha nder lesɗe jur je yimɓe ɗon wondi jur ha wakkereji ndu ha nder duniyaru sna ha nder lesɗi je ɗon tardi be ndiyam ha Pacific.

sourceString: (See updates from the WHO.)
targetString: (Laru lartolji matinolji WHO)

sourceString: The full extent of the spread is uncertain, due in part to limited testing.
targetString: Fammugo sankittol nyau man footay aanda be fakatre, ngam lartolji je wonay jur.

sourceString: Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.
targetString: Lesɗe jur ɗon mari larulaji ngam kujeji lartol ɗon timma, e yimɓe ngomna heɓɓay lartugo yimɓe fu je ɗon mari sababuji maungel, nden waɗi footay aanda limtol nyauɓe sna non ɓuran je ngomna'en ɗon hokka.

sourceString: Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.
targetString: Lesɗe bo'o ɗon feere-feere nder dabareji lartol be matinol, nden kadi foondolji limtolji nyauɓe je ɗon matini hallata tariya do noy nyau man yahidi ha nder wakkereji feere.

sourceString: The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
targetString: Viriis ndu ɗon salla gal tuɗe pofɗe be kujeji feere.

sourceString: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
targetString: Koronaviriis woni viriis je ɗon manga, bana wi'ugo yo'o wolwugo gonga sallay gal hendu: wondan ha nder daande gal tuɗe.

sourceString: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
targetString: Wondugo ha metaa ɗiɗi (kosɗe joowey e go'o) be yimɓe feere he'an ngam sallinol gal lawol ngel.

sourceString: Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.
targetString: Sallinol diga kujeji footi waɗa, bana sappinol, to goɗɗo ɓisli, memmi dammugal, e ha ɓawo man yimɓe feere memmi dammungal ngel e memma yeeso maɓɓe fahin.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
targetString: Viriis SARS-CoV-2 footi neɓɓa do takkarde ha njamɗe 24 e do leeda ngam ha balɗe 3.

sourceString: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
targetString: Sallinol diga buuwe ha hunduko footi salla bo'o.

sourceString: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Sappinolji ɗon wi'a yo'o COVID-19 ɗon raɓɓa ko to wala mandolji, nden kadi ndu lartotto ha deydey toy.

sourceString: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
targetString: Mandolji je ɓurna larni wullol ɓaandu, sondaru jorɓum, be tampere.

sourceString: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
targetString: Mandolji feere larni pofɗe bana daran, huudure do daande, paaɓooje, nawol ɓaandu, mala illol ndamba.

sourceString: Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
targetString: Nyauɓe feere ɗon mari mandolji je nyaɗay, bana ndamba.

sourceString: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
targetString: Nyaɗugo nyau man larni pneumonia, nyau saɗirma nder pofɗe be kujeji ɓaandu je ɗon dara ko ɗon yara ha wade.

sourceString: About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
targetString: Deydey 80% nyauji ɗon mari mandolji je nyaɗa, be luttuɗum man footi timmina ha suudi lekki.

sourceString: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Limtol mayde woni ha kunde 1-3% yimɓe je ɗon mari, ɓurna fu ndotti'en be nyauji feere.

sourceString: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
targetString: Limtol mayde yimɓe je ɓuri duɓɓi 70 ɓuri amma je yimɓe je maray duɓɓi 40 ɗon lessi.

sourceString: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
targetString: Yimɓe je ɗon mari sababu maungel be COVID-19 be mandolji je nyaɗum woni ndotti'en be yimɓe ɓaandu maɓɓe maray sembe mala mari nyauji feere bana nyau ɓernde, nyau sukar, nyau illol iyam be sembe, nyau pofɗe je ɗon tokkitta, sankara.

sourceString: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
targetString: Nyauɓe je matinama limmay ɓikkon jur e ɓurna ɓe'en je ɗon be nyau man nyaday sam mala deydey ko do feere'en naangi pneumonia.

sourceString: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
targetString: Jemma be naange, huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu ɗon mari sababu je maungel to foondi be yimɓe feere be sammere nyau ha kunde huwooɓe be wakkereji jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
targetString: Wakati ha kunde wondugo be viriis be fuɗɗam mandolji (wakati nuftol) ɗon ha cakka balɗe 2 be 14, ko to wodi no nyauɗo feere ha Cayna je mandolji nyau wangi ha ɓawo balɗe 27.

sourceString: As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
targetString: Ha Feviriye 2020, wakkati raɓɓol aandakke, amma lati kanduɗum to yimɓe  sappinata mandolji nyau ndu.

sourceString: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Wodi sappinol sallinol diga yimɓe je maray mandolji, ko to ekkitol do ndu luggay sam nder teffol.

sourceString: It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
targetString: Laɓɓay to footi goɗɗo je meɗɗi raɓɓi viriis footi nanga nyau man fahin ha ɓawo nyambittol.

sourceString: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
targetString: Sababuji je tolli yimɓe je nyamɓitti laɓɓay, amma woodi sappinol ustol sembe fuffu ha nyauɓe feere je nyamɓitti.

sourceString: Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
targetString: Lartol viriis ɓurna fu larni kule hoosugo lekkuje je ɓe ɗon nastina gal kine mala gal daande je lartama ha nder suudu lartol ngam viriis.

sourceString: The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
targetString: Dabare kanduɗum lartol larni wurtinol kujeji gene nder leeku e lartugo ndu ngam heɓɓugo toɓeji gene viriis je ɗon aandin.

sourceString: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
targetString: Wala lartol je ɗon sappina be fakatre wondugo viriis mala fadooɓe ɓaandu ha nder iyam ko to wodi lartolji do lawol.

sourceString: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
targetString: Wala lartol je sappinata fadol ngam viriis ndu.

sourceString: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
targetString: Ngomna'en jur ha nder lesdi feeli ummatore maɓɓe ta ɓe waɗa jaahangal je wala naffuda ha wakati nyau duniyaru ndu.

sourceString: Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
targetString: Geeɓeji jaahangalji ɗuɗɗum be caahuji siwtare ɗon walla mon be man ngam ɓe ɗon darna jaahangalji e ɗon ɓesda ceede hortol.

sourceString: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
targetString: Ɓurna bo'o lutte kombeewol ngillugo.

sourceString: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
targetString: Yimɓe je warti jaahangal be ɓe'en je mari nyauji feere ɗon mari sababu maungel e sey lutta jaahangal je lati sababu ha maɓɓe, bana jaahangal be pireewol ha lesdi dayindi, ngilli ha wakkereji je ɗon heewi be ummatore, e ɓurna fu kombeewolji, ko to ha yaasi wakkereji je nyau man memmi jur.

sourceString: In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
targetString: Ha nder wakkereji je nyau man ɗon nyaɗi ha ton, ɓurna aandoɓe ɗon feela dayol ummatore.

sourceString: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
targetString: Ndu yiɗi wi'ugo ustugo hawtirdeji be yimɓe feere gal dayugo be kosɗe joowey go'o mala metaa ɗiɗi be luttugo geeɓeji ummatore.

sourceString: Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
targetString: Wakkereji feere ɗon jaɓɓa mofturdeji petpetel; feere'en ɗon haɗɗa mofturdeji fu.

sourceString: Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
targetString: Dabareje je a ɗon feeli ngam hoosugo woni huwugo diga saare to footi waɗa, luttugo mofturde yimɓebe luttugo wurtugo saare ma to wala uja feere je ɗon kanduɗum.

sourceString: If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
targetString: To a yiɗi wurtugo, wondugo pettum man metaa ɗiɗi (kosɗe ɗiɗi) be yimɓe feere.

sourceString: In many places these measures are required.
targetString: Ha wakkereji jur dabareji ndu emmotto.

sourceString: Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
targetString: Tokkitu dabare laɓɓinol bana be aynol ndamba.

sourceString: Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
targetString: Lallu juɗe ma ha wakati fu be sabulu e nduyam gulɗam, nden yoru ndu be leepol je ɗo laɓɓi.

sourceString: As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
targetString: Nde koronaviriisji lati viriisji je ɗon suddi, lallugo juɗe moɗon be sabulu ɗon mbarda viriis ndu gal ɓoorugo laaral ɓaandu maɗa je ɗon tardi be ɓeelere.

sourceString: Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Lallugo juɗe be lawol man yiɗi yiggugo juɗe pettum man nder segonji 20.

sourceString: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
targetString: Yorugo juɗe mon je on lalli timmi be limse ɗon itta gilɗiji do ɓaandu moɗon (ta juwinu yaɓɓorde man, e ta sendu leepol ma be gooɗo feere).

sourceString: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
targetString: To wala sabulu be ndiyam, hoosu kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe je on mari alkol >60%.

sourceString: Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.
targetString: Alkol lati mbarowo gilɗi je laugel, amma na jonta-jonta, kanjuum bo'o sey ndeena sekoni 20 be yiggugo juɗe maɗa, aandugo yo'o wala baabal je ɗon lutti do laaral ɓaandu maɗa, e ha ɓawo man sey a ndeena minti feere, heɓɓa alkol ndu yora fu.

sourceString: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
targetString: Ta memmu gite, kine be hunduko maɗa be juɗe.

sourceString: Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
targetString: Yimɓe ɓurna fu ɗon memma yeeso maɓɓe ha minti seeɗa, ha nyalla fu.

sourceString: Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
targetString: Foondu waɗugo ndu, e foondu lallugo juɗe ma hiddeko a meema yeeso maɗa.

sourceString: Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
targetString: Fahin bo'o, foondu ta memmu daaldalji, ta memmu ndu lau tawon, ta be jungo meere bo'o.

sourceString: Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
targetString: Sondu e ɓislu ha nder cakkare jokke jungo ma mala ha nder leepol, e sakkinu leepol man e lallu juɗe ma.

sourceString: Don't stand or sit near people who might be sick.
targetString: Ta wondu mala joɗɗu ha koomɓe yimɓe je footi wona nyauɗo.

sourceString: Stay at least one meter – and ideally two meters (six feet) – away.
targetString: Wondu pettum man ha metaa gooto, sna non metaa ɗiɗi (kosɗe joowey e go'o), dayɗum.

sourceString: As a quick way to eyeball this distance, imagine that you and the other person both reached your hands towards each other.
targetString: Foondugo be gite footi ngaɗa, waɗu bana an be goɗɗo je wondi ha yeeso ma, ko moy  furtini jungo maɗa.

sourceString: Could you touch the other person's hand without taking a step towards that person?
targetString: Footi a memma jungo mako to a waɗay yaɓɓorde gal yeeso na?

sourceString: If the answer is yes, then you're too close.
targetString: To a jabbi oho, nden a ɗon ɓadi be mako.

sourceString: Clean objects and surfaces that a lot of people touch, such as doorknobs, phones, and television remotes with regular household cleaner.
targetString: Laɓɓinu kujeji be daaldalji je yimɓe jur memmi, bana juɗe dammuɗe, telefonji, be telekomandji tele be kuje laɓɓinugo saare.

sourceString: Disinfect the surfaces with a suitable disinfectant, such as diluted household bleach.
targetString: Laɓɓu daaldaji be kuje laɓɓugo je boɗɗe, bana wodezaavel.

sourceString: Stay home when you are sick, and avoid contact with other people until your symptoms are gone.
targetString: Joɗɗu ha saare to a saatay, e ta wondu be yimɓe feere sey to mandolji nyau ndu timmi fu.

sourceString: Do not share personal items that come into contact with saliva, such as toothbrushes, eating utensils, drinks, water bottles, and towels.
targetString: Ta sendu kujeji je hawti be tuɗe, bana kuje yiggugo ni'e, tassowo nyammugo, nyaarugo, koolobaji ndiyam, be leepolji be goɗɗo feere.

sourceString: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
targetString: Hoosugo nyiiri ha nder tassowa gooto be sokkali, leegal ha Cayna, maɗɗa sam.

sourceString: Greet people without touching them.
targetString: Sanu yimɓe bila memmugo ɓe.

sourceString: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
targetString: Luttu harlolji, muɗɗugo hunduko, sanugo be juɗe, hawtugo juɗe, mala hawtugo feere.

sourceString: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
targetString: To footay waɗa on hawta be yimɓe, nden lallu juɗe ma hiddeko e ha ɓawo man.

sourceString: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
targetString: Fadata ma ngam koronaviris, amma fadante ngam ndamba, je sababu nangugo ndu ɓuri je COVID-19 ha wakkereji jur.

sourceString: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
targetString: Ndu ɗon hisaa ma ngam nummolji bana to a nangi ndamba a tamman yo'o ɗum koronaviriis.

sourceString: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
targetString: To a ndottijo mala a ɗon nder geeɓe yimɓe je ɗon mari sababu e a footi hoosugo baatal pneumonia, hoosu baatal man.

sourceString: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
targetString: Fadata ma ngam gilɗi pneumonia be viriis je COVID-19, amma nyauɓe COVID-19 feere mayi ngamm bakteriyaji pneumonia je raɓɓi fuffu maɓɓe je maray no sembe timmi, ngam man kadi baatal pneumonia footi hisaa yonki moɗon.

sourceString: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
targetString: Watugo leepol suddugo yeeso feelama ha yimɓe je bana mari nyau ndu be yimɓe ɗon wondi be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau.

sourceString: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
targetString: Ko larni ɓe'en je sappinatta mandolji, WHO feelay leepolji suddugo yeeso, ko to ngomna'en lesɗe feere ɗon ngaɗa ndu.

sourceString: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
targetString: Wondugo irin leepolji suddugo yeeso feere ɗon feelama ha lesɗe be berniji feere bana dabareji ustugo sallinol ha kunde ummatore.

sourceString: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
targetString: Ha nder duniyaru fu, wodi ustol leepolji suddugo yeeso ha do lumo.

sourceString: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
targetString: To a ɗon ɓorni leepol suddugo yeeso, ɓornu ɗum be boɗɗum.

sourceString: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
targetString: Leepol suddugo yeeso ndu sey sudda kine be hunduko ma bila accugo baabal.

sourceString: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
targetString: Lallu juɗe ma hiddeko ɓornugo mask e ta memmu mask to a ɓorni ɗum timmi.

sourceString: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
targetString: To a memmi ɗum, lallu juɗe ma lau ha ɓawo man.

sourceString: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
targetString: To leepol suudugo yeeso soffi, ittu e saanju ɗum

sourceString: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
targetString: Ittu ndu gal ɓawo, sakkinu ɗum, ha ɓawo man lallu juɗe maɗa.

sourceString: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
targetString: Sifturu yo'o leepolji suddugo yeeso yiɗa wi'ugo ta on laɓɓina: tokkitu lallugo juɗe ha wakati fu.

sourceString: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
targetString: Ta moftu maskji ha suudu to a maray haaje man.

sourceString: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
targetString: Ustol maskji yiɗi wi'ugo yo'o huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu ɗon mari saɗirma keɓɓugo maskji, je ɗon wata ko moy fu nder sababu.

sourceString: That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
targetString: Ndu larni ordoji N95, je feelakke ngam ummatore, ndu woni kujeji huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu je wondan je maɓɓe ngam huwidugo be man.

sourceString: Leave them for healthcare workers.
targetString: Acce ɗum ha huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
targetString: Luttu wakkereji je ɗon mofti ummatore, ɓurna bo'o wakkereji je ɗon maɓɓi e hendu salla ha ton boɗɗum, bana hawtirolji, sappinolji, cuuɗi sippol maungel, hortol ummatore, be deewalji dina'en.

sourceString: Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kuɗe je larni mofturde yimɓe jur, diga ngilli dina'en ha mofturde gimmolji, darnotto ha nder duniyaru fu, ngam dabare darnugo sankittol viriis.

sourceString: Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
targetString: Baabe ngilli, filluji, hortolji footi maɓɓa, ɓurna fu ha nder lesɗe je ɗon mari nyau man.

sourceString: Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
targetString: Kuɗe feere je darnama, bana sappinolji, kuɗe espor, be jaangirdeji, sey sallotto do hawo, je yiɗi wi'ugo footi a waɗa mala lara ndu bila jaahangal.

sourceString: At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
targetString: Ha baabe sippugo neebam/kalanjiir, huwe be kujeji suddugo juɗe e laɓɓine ɗum be kuje laɓɓugo to a footi.

sourceString: After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
targetString: To a hebbini, laɓɓinu juɗe ma be kuje laɓɓugo juɗe.

sourceString: The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
targetString: Ngomna'en Lesɗe America be Kanada ɗon feela luttugo jaahangal be kombeewol ngilli.

sourceString: Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
targetString: Nyauji ɗon sankitta law do man, be suklare do jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
targetString: Ha cakka nyau je salli do kombeewal ngilli, wondugo ha seera be jippinugo yimɓe ɗon saɗi ngam yimɓe ɗuɗɗi nder ton.

sourceString: Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
targetString: Ko kombeewolji ngilli je maray nyauɗo je ɗon aandi ɓe sallini ɓe jarfuye jippol ngam hullol viriis, be sababu je salli be Diamond Princess ha Japan, je mari no nyau

sourceString: If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
targetString: To a tammi footi a raɓɓi nyau, ewnu suudu lekki mala kuɗe jaawal jam ɓaandu do yahugo be hoore maɗa ngam ta a raɓɓa yimɓe feere.

sourceString: Mention your symptoms and travel history.
targetString: Matinu mandolji nyu ma be tariya jaahangal ma.

sourceString: Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
targetString: Watu mask jam ɓaandu e tokkitu mandolji yimɓe ngomna be jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: See also: Flight and health
targetString: Laru bo'o: Fiirol be jam ɓaandu

sourceString: On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Ha nder pireewol, tokkitu irin dabare laɓɓinol ndu bana ha toy fu: lallu juɗe ma ha wakati fu, mala kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe je mari alkol to a feecay ummugo do koorowal maɗa, e ta memmu yeeso maɗa.

sourceString: Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
targetString: Teffooɓe tawi yo'o sallooɓe je wondi ha dammuɗe ɗon mari sababu je lessi ngam hawtugo be nyauɓe.

sourceString: Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
targetString: Suɓɓe jonde ha dammugal, e ta wancu nder pireewol ha wakati fiirol.

sourceString: After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
targetString: Ha ɓawo lallugo juɗe moɗon e hiddeko on joɗɗa, hoose leepolji ustugo ngam laɓɓinugo wakkere je ɗon tardi koorowal.

sourceString: Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
targetString: Ustu daaldalji, to koorowal ma ɗon be laaral you footi usta ndu bo'o.

sourceString: Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
targetString: Ta ustu koorowal limse, ngam sofnol footi wartira sallinol koyɗum.

sourceString: When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
targetString: Ha wakati huwidugo be kuje ustugo, tokkitu matinolji je ɗon windi do ɓawo man.

sourceString: And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
targetString: E siftoru yo'o, viriisji ɗon nasta gal hunduko, kine, be gite, ustugo wakkere nawata, amma wonay bana ko ɗon woylatta laɓɓinol.

sourceString: Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Lallu juɗe maɗa e ta memmu yeeso maɗa.

sourceString: And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
targetString: E hoosu leepol ngam memmugo telefon mala kujeji ordo feere.

sourceString: When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
targetString: Ha wakati yahugo ha gaɗɗa suudu, hoosu takkarde gaɗɗa suudu ngam maɓɓugo ndiyam be maɓɓitugo dammugal, ha ɓawo man sakkinu ɗum.

sourceString: Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
targetString: Fiirolji ha wakkereji je ɗon memmi ɗon waɗa yaɓɓordeji ngam ustugo sallinol heɓɓa sallooɓe wonda jam.

sourceString: For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
targetString: Bana sappinol, footi en ɓesda laɓɓinol wakkere ha wakati fu, je hokkatta jarfuye ha sukloɓe do jam ɓaandu ɓorna maskji, e je hokkata nyamdu je taskama timmi do nyamɗe je ɓe wulli tan.

sourceString: If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).
targetString: To geeɓe sallooɓe ɗon salla diga wakkere je ɗon mari nyau ndu be sembe, huwooɓe piirol ndu footi watta ɓe ha seera dayi be sallooɓe feere (e to ɗon warta no wakkere je ɗon sababu jur, matine huwooɓe piirol ngam majuum).

sourceString: You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
targetString: Footi ɓe haɗɗa ma ngam saanjogo koorowal ha nder pireewol.

sourceString: This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
targetString: Ndu bana, to goɗɗo ha nder pireewol ndu woni bana mari nyau, yimɓe nomna footi lorta ngam teffugo yimɓe je wondi no be mako ngam lartugo ɓe mala wondugo ha seera.

sourceString: COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
targetString: COVID-19 hurgotto gal ustugo manndolji be aynugo saɗirmaji.

sourceString: There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Wala baatal mala hurgol je feerejo je hurgatta koronaviriis keese ndu.

sourceString: Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
targetString: Teffol ngam baatal mala lekki je footi hurga ɗum ɗon do lawol.

sourceString: There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Wodi foondolji feere-feere be lekki HIV be lekki je mbaratta viriisji feere ngam hugugo COVID-19.

sourceString: Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
targetString: Mandolji je deydey tan footi ustama gal hoosugo paracetamol (acetaminophen).

sourceString: If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
targetString: To a mari COVID-19, lesɗeji wattan mon ha seera ha lartolji do moɗon je ɗon tokkiti sappina yo'o on maray nyau ndu.

sourceString: If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
targetString: To wondi no be goɗɗo je mari nyau COVID-19, lesɗe jur wattan mon ha seera nder balɗe 14 diga ragare wakati sababu e ayna mon to on sappinan mandolji nyau man.

sourceString: Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
targetString: Lesɗe feere lartan mon bo'o ko to on maray mandolji nyau.

sourceString: In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.
targetString: Ha nder lesɗe ɗuɗɗum, dabare jam ɓaandu ɓesdama ha gaɗɗa e waɗa yo'o footay ma ɓe jaɓɓitta limtol nyauɓe tan, wodi sa'a je ɓa salla hurgugo mon ngam wala yimɓe jam ɓaandu je footi sukla do moɗon, kujeji be ordoji.

sourceString: Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
targetString: Lesɗe jur maɓɓi mala usti fiirolji, kombeewalji, be ta'ittugo keerolji be ɗuɗɗum, ɓurnaa fu yahugo be wurtugo wakkereji je ɗon mari nnau ndu.

sourceString: Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.
targetString: Lesɗe jur usti mala darni nastirde yimɓe jaahangal je yotti, gal haɗɗugo nastugo (temma be sa'a ha yimɓe lesdi mala je maru jarfuye wondugo ha lesdi ndi) mala emman non ngam wondugo seera, ɓurna fu ha nder balɗe 14.

sourceString: Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
targetString: Ko to wondugo seera wonay dole, footi a emmotto a wona seera "be hoore ma" gal wondugo ha saare e a wala fottugo be yimɓe feere.

sourceString: The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
targetString: Darnollji je ɓuri tullugo ɗon do yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal be ɓawo ndu ha nder wakkereji je ɗon mari nyau, amma bo'o lessɗe jur ɗon ɓesda wattugo ndu ha sallooɓe je ɗon nsata.

sourceString: Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
targetString: Lesɗe feere haɗɗi hoɗɓe fu mala ɓurna fu ngam nastugo mala usti dabare yimɓe lesdi be wondooɓe dila.

sourceString: What are the affected areas?
targetString: Wakkere toy lati ɗon raɓɓi?

sourceString: Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
targetString: To, kuje man je ɗon sanja be lau ndu, be kala lesdi/wakkere/geeɓe ɗn mari wakkereji je ɗon mari darnolji.

sourceString: The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
targetString: Berniwol Wuhan lati ha do limtol ko moy fu be lesdi Cayna ɓurna fu.

sourceString: Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
targetString: Wakkereji feere larni: Faraansa, Jaamani, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, Lesɗe Inglisiya, Lesɗe America, Wakkere Schengen fu, ha yakke feere be feere'en.

sourceString: Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
targetString: Lesɗe feere jo'ini darnolji do wonde jeeya

sourceString: A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
targetString: Limtol nastirde je ɗon darni wondi ha IATA.

sourceString: It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.
targetString: Larnay darnolji fu, amma ɗon naffa bo'o.

sourceString: Keep up to date—the outbreak and the travel restrictions are changing rapidly.
targetString: Famme bo'o wakati, nyau be darnolji do jaahangal ɗon saanje law.

sourceString: For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.
targetString: Ngam waɗɗugo jaahande ha nder balɗe je warango, numme do wa

sourceString: Avoid buying tickets with a connection in an affected area – even changing planes can make you subject to restrictions.
targetString: Ta sodde batakkewol jaahangal gal wakkere je ɗon mari nyau, ko saanjol pireewolji ma footi mara darnolji.

sourceString: Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.
targetString: Fiirolji footi willake be batakkewol seeɗa ni, to ngam sankittol nyau be dabareji nastirde je ɗon saanja tum, mala ngam yimɓe seeɗa tan ɗon fiira e geeɓeji hortolji ɗon mari larulaji hebbinugo pireewol.

sourceString: You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Footi bo'o ɓe ɗaayina mon nder njamɗe ha yottol ngam lartol wullol ɓaandu be laahalji e ɗereji, mala bo'o watta mon ha seera nder asawere ɗiɗi.

sourceString: Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.
targetString: Taske ngam footi jaahargal jaahangal moɗon darnotto, bana to on ɗon wurta ha lesdi feere.

sourceString: Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.
targetString: Ko to on meeɗay wondugo ha wakkere je ɗon mari nyau wodi sababu joɗɗugo ha wakkere ndu he gaɗɗa ko on hasdi to a don nder suudu be goɗɗo mala dabare hortol be mo je ɗon mari nyau.

sourceString: For example, in late February an Italian doctor on vacation in Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) was diagnosed with COVID-19, and as a result all the guests in the hotel he stayed at were quarantined.
targetString: Bana sappinol, ha ragare Feviriye wodi lekkitajo Itali feere do siwtare ha Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) je larti bana mari nyau COVID-19, e bana ni yimɓe fu je wondi ha hotel mako joɗɗi fu ha seera.

sourceString: Lockdowns and other internal restrictions
targetString: Wondugo ha saare be darnolji je nder feere

sourceString: Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.
targetString: Lesɗe feere be wakkereji, ɓurna fu je nyau man nyaɗi ha ton , ɗon wangina wondugo ha saare be darnolji ngam jaawal do wancuru be kuɗe ummatore, ko je yimɓe je wurtay yaasi neeɓay sam.

sourceString: These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.
targetString: Ndu larni nastinol aynolji ha keerol, darnolji do jaahangal nder lesdi, maɓɓol mala ustol  kuɗe cuuɗi yamɗe mala cuuɗi kugal, darnol kuɗe ummatore ngam wurtugo saare sna to wodi naffuda uja man.

sourceString: Beyond government restrictions, individual establishments are shutting their doors and cancelling events to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ha ɓawo darnolji ngomna, cuuɗi kugal feerejo maɓɓotto dammuɗe maɓɓe be darnugo kuɗe ngam ustugo sankittol viriis.

sourceString: In China, there are extensive restrictions on transportation and activity, which vary widely by province, city, and even by district or village.
targetString: Ha Cayna, wodi darnolji ɗuɗɗum do hortol br kujeji, je ɗon saanja be lamarorde, berniwol e be distrik mala wuro fu.

sourceString: Many governments recommend against traveling to China at this time.
targetString: Ngomna'en jur ɗon feela ta on waɗa jaahangal ha Cayna.

sourceString: If you have no choice, do your research and get up-to-date information about the local situation wherever you are going.
targetString: To a wala dabare feere, waɗu teffol e hoosu matinolji je jonta do ko ɗon salla ha nder wakkere man ko toy fu je a ɗon yaha.

sourceString: People who have traveled to Hubei face particularly severe restrictions.
targetString: Yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal ha Hubei ɗon mari haɗɗolji je ɓuri tullugo.

sourceString: Examples of restrictions that you may encounter in some parts of China (this is not an exhaustive list):
targetString: Sappinolji haɗɗolji je footi on heɓɓa ha wakkere Cayna feere (ndu limtay fu ha do bo'o):

sourceString: 14-day quarantine, self-quarantine, or COVID-19 test upon arrival from other parts of China or from other countries, at your expense
targetString: Wondugo ha seera ha nder balɗe 14, wondugo ha seera be hoore moɗon, mala lartol COVID-19 ha yottol moɗon to on ummi wakkereji Cayna feere mala lesɗe feere, je nyau man woni ha ton, be ceede maɗa.

sourceString: questions about your travel and medical history (lying can get you years in prison)
targetString: emmolji do tariya jaahangal maɗa be jam ɓaandu maɗa (feewugo go hoora ma ha nder suudu fursina e salla duɓɓi ha ton)

sourceString: mandatory registration using an online or paper form
targetString: windugo inde je dole gal hawo mala do batakkewol

sourceString: requirement to wear a face mask in public
targetString: ewnandu ngam ɓornugo mask suudugo yeese ha cakka ummatore

sourceString: people who have been outside of China within 14 days not allowed into public places like malls
targetString: yimɓe je wondi ha yaasi Cay nder balɗe 14 wala jarfuye wondugo ha wakkere ummatore bana suddu fillu je manga

sourceString: shops only accept mobile payments, not cash
targetString: sey sodda kujeji gal ordo, ceede jaɓɓatakke

sourceString: restaurants, transportation and other establishments refusing service to non-Chinese citizens
targetString: cuuɗi nyamɗe, hortol be cuuɗi kuɗe feere wallatta yimɓe feere je wonay jeeyaɓe Cayna

sourceString: many forms of transportation reduced or shut down
targetString: dabareji horol ɗuɗɗum usti mala maɓɓi

sourceString: mandatory real-name registration for public transit cards
targetString: windugo inde be dule ngam karte sallugo ummatore

sourceString: access in and out of a town, village, or city completely blocked
targetString: nastol be wurtol berniwol, wuro, mala berni darnakke fu

sourceString: non-resident visitors prohibited from entering apartment complexes
targetString: ngilloɓe je wonday ha lesdi ndu haɗɗakke ngam nastugo ha cuuɗi feere

sourceString: only allowed to go outside once every two days to get supplies
targetString: mari jarfuye wurtugo nde gooto ha nder balɗe ngam soddugo kujeji

sourceString: businesses, activities, and attractions closed
targetString: filluji, kuɗe, wakkereji ngilli maɓɓakke

sourceString: businesses need local government permission to re-open
targetString: filluji yiɗi jarfuye ngomna ngam maɓɓitugo

sourceString: restaurants (if they are even open) require a minimum distance between customers
targetString: cuuɗi nyamɗe (to ɗon maɓɓiti ma) sey soddooɓe daaya oya be oya

sourceString: selling substandard face masks has a maximum sentence of life imprisonment
targetString: sippugo maskji je wonday kanduɗum footi yara dangay ha maya ha ton

sourceString: As of mid-March 2020, Europe is the epicenter of the epidemic, and many European countries have closed their borders to international travel - only border commuters and freight are allowed to cross.
targetString: Ha cakkare Maars 2020, Erop woni ɓundu nyau ndu, be lesɗe Erop ɗuɗɗum maɓɓi keerolji maɓɓe ngam jaahangal diga lesdi feere, sna  huwooɓe je wala keerol be pireewol feerejo footi salla.

sourceString: Also businesses other than food stores and pharmacies are closed, and public transport has been reduced or stopped.
targetString: Filluji je wonday cuuɗi nyamɗe be je sippol lekki maɓɓakke, hortol ummatore ustakke mala darnakke.

sourceString: In the worst affected countries including Italy, Spain and France, lockdowns like in China in January, have been implemented.
targetString: Ha lesɗe je nyau ndu tulli memmugo bana Italy, Spain be Faraansa, wondugo saare bana je Cayna ha Zaanviye ndu, ɗon wondi jonta.

sourceString: As well the EU has closed its outer borders.
targetString: EU bo'o maɓɓi keereolji maɗa je yaasi.

sourceString: COVID-19 is prevalent also in North America.
targetString: COVID-19 woni bo'o ha Woila America.

sourceString: The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).
targetString: Keereolji ha kunde Kanada, Lee America, be Mexico maɓɓakka ha jaahangalji je wonay kanduɗum, e ha nder wakkereji ɗuɗɗum haɗɗol do moftudeji jur ɗon wondi (bana wi'ugo wakkereji bana cuuɗi nyamɗe maɓɓakke, be kuɗe maɓɓakke).

sourceString: Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
targetString: Lesɗe, lamorde, be wakkereji jur wurtini tawretaji do wondugo ha saare je yiɗi filluji je wonday kanduɗum maɓɓakke.

sourceString: With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
targetString: Be fiirolji jur willakke, hakkiloji je wurti, darnolji je ɗon hasdi, jaahangal ha wakati koronaviriis footi lata saɗirma.

sourceString: Some routes are not possible.
targetString: Laabi feere ma footay waɗa.

sourceString: Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
targetString: Feere maran haaje jokkitolji je hannay do ko ɗon no salla tum, darnolji ɗum be ndeenolji jur ha kunde pireewolji.

sourceString: In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
targetString: Ha wakkere feere yiɗi wi'ugo ceede jaahangal ɗon saɗɗi masitin.

sourceString: On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
targetString: Ha wakkere feere, kubar mbelka lati fiirolji ɗuɗɗum saɗɗay do je tumtum ngam emmolji usti, e wodi sa'a maungel je a footi keeɓa koorowal je wala goɗɗo ha seera maɗa.

sourceString: Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
targetString: Waɗa jokkitolji maɗa ɓesda wakkati, ɓurna to wurtugo pireewol lesdi feere ngam nastugo pireewol lesdi e ɓurna to jaahangal maɗa larni lesdi je ɗon memmi be gonga.

sourceString: Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
targetString: Lartolji, aynolji wullol ɓaandu, batakkaji feere, be ndeenolji footi ɓesda mintiji mala njamɗe hiddeko a mara jarfuye tokkitinugo jaahangal maɗa.

sourceString: You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
targetString: Footi saɗɗa a heɓɓa  soddugo ɗerewol jaahangal wurtugo mala nastugo wakkere je wodi hakkilolji be darnolji jur.

sourceString: This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
targetString: Ndu lati larula manga to a yiɗi wurtugo wakkere je ɗon memmi.

sourceString: For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
targetString: Bana sappinol, ɗowirɗeji jur sippata ɗerewol jaahangal ummugo Cayna ngam yahugo Lesdi America (ngam sallugo do'ugo do haɗɗolji mala ngam ndeenugo pireewol sallooɓe ha yaasi).

sourceString: To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
targetString: Soddugo ɗerewol jaahangal bana ndu, footi sey a ewna ɗowirɗe pireewol ndu mala huwida be ɗowirɗe je aandakke jur.

sourceString: Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.
targetString: Dabare feere bo'o lati soddugo ɗereji jaahangal feere-feere ɗiɗi (bana sappinol, ɗerewol wurtol Cayna ha Cambodiya e ɗiɗaɓool man bo'o diga Cambodiya ha Lesɗe America), amma hakkilu ngam ta ɓe sigga ma ha seera mala majjina kujeji maɗa.

sourceString: Connecting flights can be a problem.
targetString: Jokkitugo pireewolji footi wona larula.

sourceString: The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
targetString: Sababu ɗaaggugo ha nder berniwol jokkittol ɓuri do ko wowi jonta, ngam ɗaayolji aynol be lartol be darnolji je ɗon waagare.

sourceString: Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.
targetString: Jokkitugo ha nder wakkere je ɗon mari nyau footi yotta ha darnolji nastirde ha yakke feere, e to woni no ha nder wakkere je ɗon mari nyau neeɓay ha nder lesɗe feere footay hokka ma jarfuye saanjugo pireewolji.

sourceString: On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
targetString: Ha do jaahangalji feere wodi sababu wondugo ha seera ha wakkere feere do lawol.

sourceString: So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
targetString: Nden kadi soddu ɗerewol pireewol je yahatta ciir, e to waɗatakke, nummu boɗɗum don toy footi a jokkita.

sourceString: In uncertain times, plans can change.
targetString: Ha wakati je aandakke, jaahargalji footi saanja.

sourceString: Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
targetString: Fadoɓe lesdi mala ngomna lesdi ha do lesdi feere jur wartiri huwooɓe je maray kugal jur, e ɓe'en feere darni kugal man gabbaa.

sourceString: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
targetString: Wallende jaawal sey wonda, ko to footi a ngamna lesdi maɗa je ɗon ha lesdi feere ko to je wakkere maɗa don maɓɓi.

sourceString: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.
targetString: To a ɗon no joɗɗi ngam nyau duniyaru ndu, ngomna lesdi maɗa ha lesdi feere je ɗon ɓadi footi walla ma nder heɓɓugo pireewol wartugo saare, taska ceede jaawal ngam heɓɓa a sodda ɗerewol jaahangal, mala wurtina passport jaawal.

sourceString: At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
targetString: Pettum man bo'o, footi ɓe hokka ma matinol do ko ɗon salla jonta ha nder wakkere e matina mon do dabareji be darnolji jaahangal je ɓe wurtini.

sourceString: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
targetString: Kuɗe ngomna lesdi ha lesdi feere je tumtum bana laahal wurtinugo visa be passport footi darnotto mala ustotto ha haaje jaawal, do wakkere be ngomna lesdi man.

sourceString: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
targetString: Ko to yimɓe feere ɗon ewna nyau man "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Nyau Wuhan", mala "viriis Cayna", ewnugo bana ni lati bana lasɓinol asngol ha Cayna be ha gite je jippi ha asli Cayna.

sourceString: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
targetString: Lati kooyɗum ewnugo nyau man bana "Wuhan pneumonia" mala "viriis Cayna" ha wakkereji bana Hong Kong be Taiwan.

sourceString: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
targetString: Ngam wondugo jam, ngewte be wolde je umminata hakkilo to bana yiɗi wolwugo do nyau, bana "COVID-19", "Koronaviriis keese" mala bo'o "viriis" mala "nyau duniyaru".

sourceString: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
targetString: Ha lesɗe je ɗon laffi masin ɓurna fu je yimɓe ngomna ɗon ayna wala aandal boɗɗe, ɗowitinugo tawreta je wala wurtugo, wonde mala wala wurtugo saare ɗon lati bana haɓre, e ɗon waɗa sembe je hannay do ummatore ha yakke feere.

sourceString: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
targetString: Heeɗite tawretaji ndu, e lutte mofturde ummatore.

sourceString: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
targetString: Bana sappinol nyau koronaviriis, gaanyo be hoɗɓe ummi ha lesɗe jur, aranool amma na kanjum tan ɗon larni yimɓe je ɗon naandi yimɓe Cayna.

sourceString: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
targetString: Wodi larulaji ngam asgnol jur je ummiki ha nder duniyaru do yimɓe je ummi gal Funaange Asia, ha ɓurna berniji bana New York, London be San Francisco.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
targetString: Ha Hong Kong, Sinophobia, je ɗon no woni jur timmi, ɓesdi be wangirde nyau duniyaru ndu, be sappinolji je cuuɗi fillu be cuuɗi nyamɗe suklata do yimɓe lesdi Cayna e ɗon farta ngewtooɓe wolde Mandarin (sna yimɓe Taiwan tan).

sourceString: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
targetString: Yahde gaanyol hoɗɓe ɓesdi bo'o ha Funaange Asia, be cuuɗi nyamɗe be filluji feere ha Japan be Cayna je ɗon salla suklugo do soddooɓe lesdi feere.

sourceString: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
targetString: Ha Cayna, wodi larulaji do hoɗɓe je ɓe sallini ɓe suudu gal huwooɓe hotelji, yimɓe je ummi lesdɗe feere, ɓurna fu ɓaaleɓe, je ɓe wurtini ɓe be sembe ha nder saare maɓɓe do hasduye marɗo saare.

sourceString: Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
targetString: Matinolji feere do nyau koronaviriis larni:

sourceString: The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
targetString: Ɗowirɗeji Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesɗe America

sourceString: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (daily updates)
targetString: Ɗowirɗeji Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesɗe Erop (matinolji lartama tum)

sourceString: United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
targetString: Ngomna Lesɗe Inglisiya, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers

sourceString: An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
targetString: Karte be sappinol je ɗon woni do internati gal John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering ɓe matinolji lartotto do gite mon

sourceString: Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
targetString: Batakkewol darnolji nastirde IATA beThe New York Times

sourceString: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
targetString: Wodi ngewteji do matinolji be tufle kalluɗum do viriis ɗon salla do internati be feere ma gal yimɓe ngomna, nden kadi sey on hakkila be moy hokki mon matinolji ndu.

sourceString: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
targetString: Famme bo'o to matinolji be feeloji fu je on keeɓi feelama gal lekkitoɓe be teffoɓe je ɗon aandi mari aandal .

sourceString: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
targetString: Ha nder larula, lati kanduɗum teffugo fammugo matinolji keese, amma wonan bo'o kanduɗum ha jam hakkilo moɗon larta matinolji je naffata on, o teffe matinolji je wurti gal hunduko je ɗon mari amana.

sourceString: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
targetString: To a ɗon no lara matinolji nde ɗiɗi ha nder balɗe, nden kadi joɗɗidu do jaahargal ndu e suklu do waɗɗugo kuje feere, do tokkitugo larugo matinolji ha nder njamɗe 24.

sourceString: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).
targetString: Koronaviriis je naandi SARS b'Bat  WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), je ɓe ɗon ewna ha yakke feere koronaviriis je naandi SARS WIV1, woni asngol koronaviriis (SARSr-CoV) je ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe je nyaɗum je tawama ha nder bilwili je naandi paɗɗe puccu (Rhinolophus sinicus) Cayna.

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Bana naandi koronaviriisji fu, ɓiɓe viriisji mari kosngal RNA woore tan je ɗon suudi ha nder suudu feere.

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Tawol ɗon sappina yo'o bilwili on woni ɓundu SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Lartol asngol gene ɗon sappina dabare sallinol SARS diga bilwili ha goɗɗo bila sallugo gal patuuji Cayna bana cakkare suudu, bana ɗon tammi ha aran.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Wurtinol lekki b'COVID-19 lati laahal teffol ngam wurtinugo baatal je aynugo mala lekki je hurgatta je footi usta sembe nyau koronaviriis 2019-20 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: International Clinical Trials Registry Platform je WHO windi ekkitolji jam ɓaandu 536 ngam wurtinugo hurgolji nyau COVID-19 , be hawtirdeji je mabardugo viriis ngam hurgugo nyauji feere je ɗon do teffol sey larta ndu

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Ha Maars, WHO fuɗɗi "SOLIDARITY Trial" ha nder lesɗe  10, be windugo yimɓe je mari nyau COVID-19 ngam lartugo sababuji hurgol,be hawtirdeji kujeji je mbardatta viriis nay be naffuda je ɓuri kanduɗum.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: Lartol fu fuɗɗi ha Aviiril 2020 ngam lartugo yahde foondolji baatal be lekki hurgugo COVID-19. Wurtinugo baatal mala lekki ɗon mari yaɓɓordeji jur, ɓurna fu hoosan duɓɓi joowey ngam jam be naffuda hawtirdeji lekki man.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Wurtinugo lekki lati laahal wanginugo baatal mala lekki hurgugo nyau keese je ɗon raɓɓa yimɓe ha do lumo to wodi hawtirde lekki je aranool ɗon maandi gal laahal tawol.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: Larni teffol do gilɗiji be daabaji ha nder suudu lartol, emmugo fadol, bana gal FDA, ngam teffugo lekki keese lata foondotto ha suudu lekkita do neɗɗo, e footi mara yaɓɓorde heɓɓugo jaɓɓol fadol be wurtinugo lekki keese ha do lumo.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Wurtinol baatal mala lekki je mbardatta viriis COVID-19 ɗon fuɗɗa be tawugo lekki gooto be dabare prophylactic baatal ndu mala kuɗe mbardugo viriis je ɗon yeeɗa.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: Kuujeji feere keese (NCE, je mbiyotto bo'o kujeji molecular keese mala NME) lati hawtirde kujeji je wangi gal laahal tawol lekki ngam aandinugo baatal mala foondoowo mbarugo viriis.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Ndu ɗon yahida be kugal tawugo lekki nyau COVID-19.

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: Ha fuɗɗam wurtinol baatal mala lekki, wala kuje jur ɗon aandin do jam, nyaɗol, pharmacokinetikjin be noy NCE man huwan ha nder ɓaandu.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Lati kugal e dole nder laahal wurtinol lekki ngam larta kujeji je ɗon limti ndu fu hiddeko foondol  do neɗɗo ngam jam be naffuda.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: Dabare kanduɗum ha nder wurtinol lekki lati hokkugo limtol be jaahargal hoosugo lekki man ha neɗɗo ha arandere man ("arandere-ha-neɗɗo" [FIH] First Human Dose [FHD], je ɗon no aandin bana "aranool-ha-goɗɗo" [FIM]).
